subject: Technology
title: Cobalt Mining and Human Cost
description: A short lesson to help you apply Cobalt Mining and Human Cost.

hook.text: Every smartphone battery contains cobalt. Over 70% of the world's cobalt comes from one country: the DRC.

buildup.text: In the Democratic Republic of Congo, some cobalt is mined by hand in dangerous, unregulated conditions.

discovery.text: Investigations found children as young as seven working in cobalt mines to supply global tech companies.

twist.text: Tech companies pledged ethical sourcing. But tracing cobalt through complex supply chains is extremely hard.

climax.text: New battery technologies aim to reduce or eliminate cobalt. But today's phones still depend on it.

punchline.text: Your phone's battery has a human cost most people never see.

quiz.question: Where does most of the world's cobalt come from?
